tag.description:
Client behavior using jquery.typewatch to trigger an AJAX call in case a user has typed text in an input, textarea or changes in a DIV from editors (including HTML 5 input types) and after the user has stopped typing for a specified amount of time.

The presence of an onchange attribute on the parent, including the JavaScript action that is executed after waiting time has passed, is required. A 'value' parameter is passed containing the input-value or content of the observed element. The JavaScript context is the parent element.

More information and examples can be found in the Reference Documentation

attribute.description: Allows a non-multiline element to be submitted (enter key) regardless of captureLength. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: allowSubmit

attribute.description: The number of milliseconds to wait after the the last key press before firing the callback. Defaults to 750ms.
attribute.name: wait

attribute.description: Highlights the element when it receives focus. Defaults to true.
attribute.name: highlight

attribute.description: Minimum # of characters necessary to fire the callback. Defaults to 2.
attribute.name: captureLength

attribute.description: The component ids to be processed via ajax.
attribute.name: process

attribute.description: The component ids to be updated via ajax.
attribute.name: update

attribute.description:
Method expression to be called after the typewatch was triggered and the model was updated with the new value. The listener must be in the form of 
public void methodName()
attribute.name: listener
